New Records: Matthew Wade hit three consecutive sixes from Shaheen Afridi in the 39th over to send Australia to the T20 World Cup final.
Mohammed Rizwan became the first player to score over 1,000 runs in T20 international cricket in a calendar year.
Key Match Events: Matthew Wade hit a hat-trick of sixes from Shaheen Afridi in the 39th over.
Australia chased down 177 with an over to spare.
Pakistan's innings was marked by a brutal slugfest, with Mohammed Rizwan launching Josh Hazlewood for six and Fakhar Zaman hitting sixes in successive balls in the last over.
Shadab Khan took 4-26 from his four overs of leg-spin, the best figures in a T20 World Cup semi-final to date.
Pre-Game Insights: Matthew Hayden, Pakistan's batting consultant, warned on the eve of the game that Fakhar Zaman was finding his range.
The placid nature of the wicket was a tribute to the groundstaff given the amount of traffic there had been on this block in the past two months.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan's defeat felt harsh, especially on Shadab Khan, who had played some of the most thrilling cricket over the past three weeks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mohammed Rizwan played a dogged innings with the bat despite being on a sickbed in hospital the night before the game and suffering a facial injury.
Pakistan's wicketkeeper played with a lump protruding from the side of his face for the rest of the innings.
Others: The match will set up a repeat of the 2015 50-over final, as Australia will face New Zealand in two days' time.
